answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Cayce – I hope the following is helpful.  Each of these cities have GIS capabilities from their homepage(s):
Roanoke, VA –http://www.roanokeva.gov/WebMgmt/ywbase61b.nsf/DocName/$home 
San Antonio, TX https://gis.sanantonio.gov/GIS/default.aspx
Alexandria, VA
http://alexandriava.gov/GIS 
ABQ, NM
http://www.cabq.gov/gis 
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org

answers.author: Kelsey Rydland
answers.text:
Cayce were you able to find something that worked well for you? We have 23 local government members in our organization and how they integrate GIS into their website varies. They use our custom built MapOffice application but I know there are options available through ESRI's ArcGIS Online that you could look at for providing some basic mapping for our community. Please feel free to send me a message if you have questions or if there is something I can help you with.

answers.author: Cayce Hanger
answers.text:
We are currently looking into ArcGIS Online and Digimap as a solution. I'll let you know what we decide on soon, for the new budget year is quickly approaching!

author: Cayce Hanger
text:
We are looking into integrating GIS maps on our internet homepage. Has anyone done this at a fairly reasonable price? What software or service are you using?
Thanks!
title: GIS maps on homepage
